greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Least integer k such that A249431(k) = n, and -1 if no such integer exists.
comment: a(n) = the least natural number k such that {product of elements on row k of Pascal's triangle} is divisible by (k+n)! but not by (k+n+1)!
Note: a(18) = 3144 and a(24) = 2974. First values k for which A249431(k) = 16 and 17, if they exist, are larger than 4096.
program: (Scheme) (define (A249430 n) (let loop ((k 0)) (cond ((= n (A249431 k)) k) (else (loop (+ 1 k))))))
xref: Nonnegative terms are all members of A249434.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 02 2014
